bio.p: Prof. Donald Huisingh received his Ph.D. with majors in Biochemistry and Plant Pathology from the University of Wisconsin in 1965. He has taught at universities in 80 countries. He is emeritus Professor and Senior Scientist in Sustainable Development at the University of Tennesseeâ€™s Institute for a Secure and Sustainable Environment and visiting professor in several renowned universities across Europe. He founded the Journal of Cleaner Production in 1992 and was the Editor-in Chief of it from 1992 to 2015. He has done research and teaching on topics, such as plant pathology, biochemistry, cleaner production, life cycle assessment, waste minimization, circular economies, industrial symbiosis, corporate social responsibility, B-corporations, sustainable and equitable cites, education for sustainable development in higher education. He is the author or co-author of more than 300 professional publications.
